wikipedia_page.main:
Ben Ambler Wilson (22 September 1921 – September 1993) was an English cricketer.  Wilson was a left-handed batsman who bowled slow left-arm orthodox.  He was born at Knaresborough, Yorkshire.
Wilson made a single first-class appearance for Warwickshire against Scotland at Edgbaston in 1951.  Scotland made 359 in their first-innings, with Wilson taking the wicket of William Edward with figures of 1/75 from twenty overs.  In response Warwickshire made 332 all out, with Wilson being dismissed for a duck by Samuel Thomson.  The match ended in a draw.  This was his only major appearance for Warwickshire.
He later played for Suffolk in the Minor Counties Championship, making his debut for the county in 1955 against the Essex Second XI.  He played Minor counties cricket for Suffolk from 1955 to 1959, making sixteen appearances.  He died at Whitby, Yorkshire in September 1993.  His father, Benjamin Wilson, played first-class cricket for Yorkshire.

response: Benjamin, Benny, Bennie, or Ben Wilson may refer to:
* Ben Wilson (English artist) (born 1963), London based artist
* Ben Wilson (American artist) (1913–2001), Abstract Expressionist
* Ben Wilson, 4th Baron Nunburnholme (1928–1998), British peer

* Ben Wilson (American football coach) (1926–1970), American football coach
* Ben Wilson (fullback) (born 1939), former professional American football player
* Ben Wilson (basketball) (1967–1984), basketball player
* Ben Wilson (Australian footballer) (born 1977), Australian rules footballer
* Ben Wilson (motorcyclist) (born 1982), superbike rider
* Ben Wilson (speedway rider) (born 1986), professional speedway rider
* Ben Wilson (footballer, born 1992) (born 1992), English footballer
* Ben Wilson (kitesurfer) (born 1977), Australian kitesurfer
* Ben Wilson (musician) (born 1967), American musician and keyboardist for the band Blues Traveler
Wilson died in September 1957 in Harrogate, Yorkshire. His son, Ben Wilson, played one match for Warwickshire.
